ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ayɛ̌, Elônde gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn sáʼa pàga ngwòŋ Ngalílîa júʼ páʼ mé ne ńgɔɔn menò mie Yěsô ne ńgÿo,
en: At that time   Herod the tetrarch  # 14:1 Mk 8:15; Lk 3:19; 13:31; 23:7; Ac 4:27; 12:1; 13:1 heard the report about Jesus.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó mentsìndá pé ngie: «Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ge gǎa wɔ́, é gwɔ́ Jÿâŋ Mbabtísè, mbà à zǐm! Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá á kuʼu légÿo menò mɔɔnmɔɔn.»
en: “This is John the Baptist,” he told his servants. “He has been raised from the dead, and that’s why miraculous powers are at work in him.”

ngiemboon: Elônde gɔɔn púʼu, mélàʼmie à la gÿo mé gwoon Jÿâŋ, ńkwɛ́ɛ yé ńnéŋe tsǎŋ, mélàʼ Elondiyad gẅie à laa nzwě Filib, fɛ̌ Elônde ŋwɛ́.
en: For Herod had arrested John, chained   him, and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife,  # 14:3 Mt 4:12; 11:2; Jn 3:24

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Jÿâŋ ka ne ńgwá ńkaga yé ngie: «Lepʉ̌ té ne ńzẅíŋe ngie à zɔ́ʼɔ Elondiyad wɔ́.»
en: since John had been telling him, “It’s not lawful   for you to have her.”

ngiemboon: Elônde júʼ, ńzye léfaʼ shÿó lézẅé Jÿâŋ, tá nně ḿbɔ́gɔ nÿɔ́g pà Yúndà. Á nue pɔ́b metsèm la ne ńzsé ngie Jÿâŋ aa ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: Though Herod wanted to kill John, he feared the crowd since they regarded John as a prophet.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn, lélɔg ńkímte lyɛ̌ʼ gie mé la zyé fùɔ Elônde. Míŋ Elondiyad wemanzwě zíŋe mvfò láʼ. Anò pú ḿboŋo Elônde,
en: When Herod’s birthday celebration came, Herodias’s daughter danced before them   and pleased Herod.

ngiemboon: tà á gɔɔn tà ńkʉa ngie: À lɔɔn ńdúɔ pɔ́ kɔ́ mbwó yé wɔ́, mbà à ge ná.
en: So he promised with an oath to give her whatever she asked.

ngiemboon: Má pà múɔ manzwě tsóte múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, ngie à gʉa ńgɔɔn ngie à ne ńkwoŋo twó Jÿâŋ Mbabtísè á tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn.
en: Prompted by her mother, she answered, “Give me John the Baptist’s head here on a platter.”

ngiemboon: Afùɔ júʼ ḿbú ḿmÿɔg tɛʼ. Tá le gwɔ́ gie à ně ńgɔɔn mvfò megʉ̀ pé tà ńkʉa gÿo á tsẅi ngie mé náa twó Jÿâŋ mbwó múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́,
en: Although the king regretted it, he commanded that it be granted because of his oaths and his guests.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńtúmo nyìŋ, á gʉa ndátsǎŋ, ńzáʼa twó Jÿâŋ,
en: So he sent orders and had John beheaded in the prison.

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ, ńdɔg ńtó, ńnáa mbwó múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, á kẅé, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó má we.
en: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, who carried it to her mother.

ngiemboon: Engàŋakwò Jÿâŋ tó, ńkaa pfó yé, ńdɔg ńgʉa ńtúŋ. Tà á kuʼ, pɔ́ gʉa shwóŋo Yěsô nò gie á cʉ̌a.
en: Then his disciples came, removed the corpse,   buried it, and went and reported to Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô júʼu yɔɔn nò, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ ne ńgee né jʉʼ gie nyìŋ te wó wɔ́. Aláʼ zsé, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńgiŋe kʉ̀ŋ ntse ḿvɔg ńzáʼa yé.
en: When Jesus heard about it,   he withdrew from there by boat to a remote place to be alone. When the crowds heard this, they followed him on foot from the towns.

ngiemboon: Á kúu jʉʼó, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ ńkẅɛ, ńgyá nùɔ láʼ, mezìŋe mɔ́b kúu yé. Á zye légÿo megàŋa guɔ pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b zeŋe.
en: When he went ashore,   he saw a large crowd, had compassion on them, and healed their sick.  # 14:14 Mt 4:23; 9:36

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, ngàŋakwò Yěsô tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pege ee jʉʼɔɔn kwòŋotsẅɛ, mbà zàʼ pǐŋ ńcʉa. Tsẅi né pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gʉa jʉʼ gie membʉ̀a ée wó, éfaʼ shúm léjÿó ńjú.»
en: When evening came, the disciples   approached him and said, “This place is deserted, and it is already late.  # 14:15 Lit and the time (for the evening meal) has already passed Send the crowds away so that they can go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ge gʉa tsɔ́ jʉʼ wɔ́. Pi zɔ ge náa mmó pɔ́ pfɛ́.»
en: “They don’t need to go away,” Jesus told them. “You give them something to eat.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Peg gẅiin pɔ́ ndàʼ mbelég mbuʼú ntʉ̂a jʉʼɔɔn, ńgÿo ssó mbaŋ pʉ́a.»
en: “But we only have five loaves and two fish here,” they said to him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi lɔg ńtó, ńná né mèŋ.»
en: “Bring them here to me,” he said.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ńtsẅi à láʼ pwɔ́ʼɔ legǐ ńnéŋe mǒ. Á pí mbelég ayɛ̌ mbuʼú ntʉ̂a, né messó mɛ̌ mbaŋ pʉ́a, ḿbʉʼʉ twó yé, ńdíe tÿǒ, ésíe Ssé, ḿbwɔ́ʼte ńnáa mbwó ngàŋakwò yé, pɔ́ gaba mbwó láʼ.
en: Then he commanded the crowds to sit down on the grass. He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed them. He broke the loaves and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ pfɛ́, ńzẅɛ́. Mé cúʼte mepfwɔ̀ʼ, é lúe tsɛ̀ɛ metúŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém.
en: Everyone ate and was satisfied. They picked up twelve baskets full of leftover pieces.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é la pfɛ́ɛ mmó laa mbàŋa mmó ntsáʼ tʉ̂a, té sáŋ panzwě pâ gubé.
en: Now those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńtsẅii mbwó ngàŋakwò yé ngie pɔ́ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ, ḿvɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ńtúm né yetsɔ́ nzǐŋ, à cʉ́ʼ nzèm ńdeʼe menùɔ láʼ, é gʉa.
en: Immediately   he  # 14:22 Other mss read Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowds.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́ʼ ńdeʼe menùɔ láʼ, ńkwɔ́ʼɔ ndùm lekwɔʼɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé. Nzěm gÿo ńgwaa síŋ, á cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ jʉʼó pɔ́ gíle yé,
en: After dismissing the crowds, he went up on the mountain by himself to pray. Well into the night, he was there alone.

ngiemboon: mbà kanúʼ zyě ńgiŋ tà ńgwɔ́ soŋ ntse. Ntse ne ńgege pʉ̀a pé, mélàʼmie fèfà la ne ńtóo pɔ́ mvfò mvfò.
en: Meanwhile, the boat was already some distance   from land,  # 14:24 Other mss read already in the middle of the sea battered by the waves, because the wind was against them.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ nkwɔ̀ʼ njÿó, Yěsô gwɔ́ jwoŋte wɔ́b, ńne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse.
en: Jesus came toward them walking on the sea   very early in the morning.  # 14:25 Lit fourth watch of the night = 3 to 6 a.m.

ngiemboon: Engàŋakwò yé gyá páʼ à ne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse, ńzye lépɔ́g, ńkwaŋ ngie áa gʉgÿɛ́ nyìŋ, ḿbú ńgaʼte, á nue pɔ́ la ne ńcÿɔʼɔ.
en: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were terrified. “It’s a ghost! ” they said, and they cried out in fear.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yěsô gwóon ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi pʉ́le ńnéŋe, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ, tà pi pɔ́g.»
en: Immediately Jesus spoke to them. “Have courage! It is I. Don’t be afraid.”

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kwàʼ gú, ɔ̀ gÿo mèŋ n giŋe ndùm ntse, ńtó ńzáʼa gú.»
en: “Lord, if it’s you,” Peter answered him, “command me to come to you on the water.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né ye ngie: «Tóo! Piɛ kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ, ńne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse légʉa ńzáʼa yé.»
en: He said, “Come.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgyá fèfà ne ńcʉʼʉ tɛʼ, á pɔ́g, ńzye lémeʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńdeen ńké ńgaʼte ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n kwě le.»
en: But when he saw the strength of the wind,   he was afraid, and beginning to sink he cried out, “Lord, save me! ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńtsege pwó yé ńkwɔ́bɔ yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Agù lézáb ntʉ́m na Ssé à kʉ̌a! Ɔ̀ gwǎ mʉ́ʼte ńgaa?»
en: Immediately Jesus reached out his hand, caught hold of him, and said to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ yé kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ, fèfà záʼa.
en: When they got into the boat, the wind ceased.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ kanúʼ ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie: «Áa kwàʼ nénʉ́, ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé.»
en: Then those in the boat worshiped him and said, “Truly you are the Son of God.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ túm ntse tà ńkúu na nzǐŋ ye Jÿenezalɛd.
en: When they had crossed over,   they came to shore at Gennesaret.  # 14:34 Mk 6:5; Lk 5:1

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a jʉʼó la liŋe Yěsô, ńgwóon ńkÿote ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ membʉ̀a, ésáʼ, éshwóŋo láʼ, mé lɔg megàŋa guɔ ntsèm, ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ yé,
en: When the men of that place recognized him, they alerted the whole vicinity and brought to him all who were sick.

ngiemboon: ésẅíŋte yé ngie à fó ńzẅíŋ, pɔ́ kíbe pɔ́ ndàʼ tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ yé. Epʉ̀a metsèm pie é la kíbe tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ ŋwɛ́ pú ńzeŋe.
en: They begged him that they might only touch the end of his robe, and as many as touched it were healed.
